meanings.definition: Provided with more funding than necessary.
meanings.sent1: The school was overfunded, so they had extra money for new books.
meanings.sent2: The project became overfunded, leading to a surplus of resources.
meanings.sent3: The overfunded charity had so much money, they started giving out free ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her overfunded piggy bank was bursting at the seams with coins.
meanings.sent5: The overfunded party had so many decorations, it looked like a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: Having an excess amount of funds.
meanings.sent1: The overfunded company could afford to expand to new markets.
meanings.sent2: The organization was overfunded, allowing them to support multiple projects simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The overfunded budget made the financial team do a happy dance.
meanings.sent4: His overfunded wallet was so thick, it couldn't fit in his pocket.
meanings.sent5: The overfunded savings account grew larger every month.
